articles.author: Joseph Sipalan
articles.title: Sabah-Sarawak gas pipeline exploded, situation under control: official
articles.description: A Malaysian fire and rescue department official confirmed on Monday that there was an explosion on Sunday on the Sabah-Sarawak Gas Pipeline in East Malaysia but the situation is now under control.
articles.content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Reuters) - A Malaysian fire and rescue department official confirmed on Monday that there was an explosion on Sunday on the Sabah-Sarawak Gas Pipeline in East Malaysia but the situation is now under control.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: South African rand firms ahead of U.S.-China trade deal signing
articles.description: South Africa's rand strengthened against the dollar early on Monday as the imminent signing of the Sino-U.S. Phase 1 trade deal boosted risk appetite globally, though a power crunch that has dimmed the domestic economic growth outlook remained a risk.

articles.title: Heads of warring Libyan sides to meet in Moscow - Russian foreign ministry
articles.description: Russia's foreign ministry said the heads of Libya's two warring factions will hold talks in Moscow on Monday, the Interfax news agency reported.
articles.content:
MOSCOW (Reuters) - Russia’s foreign ministry said the heads of Libya’s two warring factions will hold talks in Moscow on Monday, the Interfax news agency reported.

articles.title: Italy's upcoming regional vote will not decide future of government: paper
articles.description: The results of an upcoming regional vote will not decide the future of Italy's national government and ruling parties will meet at the end of the month to set the executive's agenda, Prime Minister Conte said in an interview on Monday.
articles.content:
ROME (Reuters) - The results of an upcoming regional vote will not decide the future of Italy’s national government and ruling parties will meet at the end of the month to set the executive’s agenda, Prime Minister Conte said in an interview on Monday.

articles.title: Investors see safety in China's yuan as Phase 1 trade deal nears
articles.description: China's yuan, fresh from a second year of weakening against the U.S. dollar, is enjoying an unusual turn as a haven as Washington and Beijing prepare to sign an eagerly awaited Phase 1 trade deal this week.
articles.content:
SHANGHAI/HONG KONG, Jan 13 (Reuters) - China’s yuan, fresh from a second year of weakening against the U.S. dollar, is enjoying an unusual turn as a haven as Washington and Beijing prepare to sign an eagerly awaited Phase 1 trade deal this week.

articles.author: Ryan Woo
articles.title: With nothing to lose, loners build future in China's hollowed-out north
articles.description: But the 32-year-old ship mechanic became a minor internet sensation last month after posting a video of his everyday life in a largely forgotten coal city in the country's far north.
articles.content:
HEGANG, China (Reuters) - Li Hai is a nobody in China. 
But the 32-year-old ship mechanic became a minor internet sensation last month after posting a video of his everyday life in a largely forgotten coal city in the country’s far north.

articles.title: Three teachers killed near Kenya's Somalia border in a suspected militant attack - police
articles.description: Three teachers were killed in Kenya near the country's border with Somalia in a suspected attack by al Shabaab militants, a police report seen by Reuters said on Monday, in what would be the latest assault by the group since the new year.

articles.title: Switzerland's Obseva eyes China re-start for fertility drug that failed trial

ZURICH (Reuters) - ObsEva struck a pact with China’s Yuyuan BioScience Technology to develop and commercialize the fertility drug nolasiban, the Swiss drugmaker said on Monday as it seeks to inject new life into a medicine that had flopped a trial.

articles.title: Gunshots heard at Iran protests after plane disaster: social media posts
